page.title: 14HOME LIFE TYPICAL SATURDAY
page.content: On Saturday I get up very early to go to the garage with my Dad. It takes about 15 minutes to get there because we stop at the newsagent for a paper. Dad opens the door and the alarm goes off. He turns it off. I open the petrol pumps and pull the OPEN sign over to the pavement. I rush back in and open the workshop to get out the barbecues, patio sets and the oil rack. Dad always gets the gardening rack out because it is too heavy for me. Next I read the newspaper for half an hour. When customers come, Dad lets me serve them. They give the money to me and I put it in the till. Sometimes "Mike the Trike" comes in. He has the oldest trike in Britain and is very funny. He sometimes gives me a ride on his trike. At one o'clock we lock everything up and go home to have our lunch.
